alert.note: Alert for Collin; Denton; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 5:39PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern Grayson County and portions of Northern Denton and Collin County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Anna, Celina, Pilot Point, Van Alstyne, Howe, Aubrey, Whitewright, Gunter, Bells, Tom Bean, Savoy, Trenton, Dorchester, Valley Lake, Southmayd, Tioga, Weston, Farmington and Elmont.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
